title: feat(survey): Optimize AdapterSurvey with background queries
body:
- Created `SurveyInfo` DTO to hold survey metadata.
- Added `getSurveyInfos` to `SurveyRepository` to fetch survey metadata in bulk on a background thread.
- Updated `SurveyFragment` to call `getSurveyInfos` and pass the data to `AdapterSurvey`.
- Modified `AdapterSurvey` to use the pre-fetched data, removing Realm queries from the `bind` method.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/12908985054132726717

title: voices: smoother buttons visibility (fixes #8907)
body: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b36426b1-c33c-4b8f-b2e0-da44541edd3c

title: Refactor: Use ListAdapter for AdapterMeetup
body:
Refactored `AdapterMeetup` to extend `ListAdapter`, improving performance by leveraging `DiffUtil` for efficient list updates.

- Changed `AdapterMeetup` to inherit from `ListAdapter`.
- Implemented a `DiffUtil.ItemCallback` to efficiently calculate differences in the `RealmMeetup` list.
- Removed the need to pass the list in the constructor and eliminated the `getItemCount` method.
- Updated `TeamCalendarFragment` to use `submitList` to update the adapter's data.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/11841338020280414433

title: feat(profile): Move TeamListAdapter diffing to background thread
body:
Moves the `DiffUtil.calculateDiff` operation in `TeamListAdapter` to a background coroutine to prevent blocking the main thread.

- Modified `TeamListAdapter` to accept a `CoroutineScope` in its constructor.
- Updated `updateList` to launch a coroutine on the provided scope.
- `DiffUtil.calculateDiff` is now executed on `Dispatchers.IO`.
- The `membersList` and `RecyclerView` are updated on `Dispatchers.Main`.
- Updated `LoginActivity` to pass its `lifecycleScope` to the adapter.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/9605718022012992077

title: Refactor: Move heavy work in AdapterTeamList to a background thread
body:
Moved the expensive filtering and data processing in `AdapterTeamList` to a background thread to prevent UI jank.

- Replaced `MainScope` with a custom `CoroutineScope` using `SupervisorJob` and `Dispatchers.Default`.
- Ensured all UI updates are performed on the main thread using `withContext(Dispatchers.Main)`.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/15051917523814764100

title: Refactor: Use lifecycle-aware CoroutineScope in AdapterReports
body:
- Injected `lifecycleScope` into `AdapterReports` to manage coroutine lifecycles properly, preventing potential leaks.
- Shifted database operations in `updateReport` and `archiveReport` to a background thread using `withContext(Dispatchers.IO)` to avoid blocking the main thread.
- Removed the creation of unmanaged `CoroutineScope`s in click handlers.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/5630817097168372966

title: Refactor: Use lifecycle-aware coroutine scope in `showAlert`
body:
Replaced the unstructured `CoroutineScope(Dispatchers.IO)` with a lifecycle-aware scope (`viewLifecycleOwner.lifecycleScope`) passed from the fragment. This prevents potential memory leaks by ensuring the coroutine is cancelled when the fragment's view is destroyed.

Disabled the "Save" button in the `showAlert` dialog during the save operation to prevent duplicate submissions and provide better user feedback.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/140722402844605510

title: feat: Optimize AdapterTask by caching assignee names
body:
- Implemented an in-memory cache for assignee display names to avoid repeated Realm queries during `onBindViewHolder`.
- Moved database lookups to a background thread using Kotlin coroutines to prevent blocking the main thread.
- Added a mechanism to cancel ongoing lookups for recycled views to prevent race conditions and incorrect UI updates.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/10736980740829179369

title: Refactor TeamTaskFragment to use ListAdapter
body:
Refactored `TeamTaskFragment` to use a `ListAdapter` with `DiffUtil` to improve performance and reduce UI jank.

- Created a `TeamTask` data class to represent task items.
- Added a `DiffUtil.ItemCallback` for `TeamTask`.
- Refactored `AdapterTask` to extend `ListAdapter`.
- Updated `TeamTaskFragment` to use the new adapter, initializing it once and using `submitList()` to update the UI.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/1118576464086764800

title: feat: Optimize AdapterResource with payload updates
body:
Replaced `notifyDataSetChanged()` with `notifyItemRangeChanged()` and a payload to efficiently update checkboxes without rebinding the entire row.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/129594968515998168

title: Refactor: Move Realm lookup to background thread in AdapterResource
body:
Moved the `tagRepository.getTagsForResource` call in `displayTagCloud` to the IO dispatcher using `withContext(Dispatchers.IO)`.

This prevents a Realm database lookup from running on the main thread, which could cause UI freezes.

Added checks for `isActive` and adapter position to prevent crashes due to view holder recycling before updating the UI.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/13930894712113326649

title: Refactor ApiClient.executeWithRetry to be a suspend function
body:
- Created a new suspend function `executeWithRetryAndWrap` that calls `RetryUtils.retry` without `runBlocking`.
- Deprecated the original `executeWithRetry` function.
- Refactored `SyncManager.kt` to use the new suspend function, removing `runBlocking` calls and updating function signatures.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/12478455495479512859

title: Refactor UserProfileDbHandler to use short-lived Realm instances
body:
This commit refactors the `UserProfileDbHandler` to eliminate the global Realm instance, instead using short-lived instances provided by a `realmService`.

Changes:
- Removed the class-level `Realm` property and its initialization.
- Updated login/logout and metrics methods to request short-lived Realm instances inside their own blocks instead of reusing `mRealm`.
- Removed the custom `onDestroy` requirement once no long-lived Realm remains.
- Replaced manual `executeTransactionAsync` with `realmService.withRealmAsync` to ensure proper lifecycle management.
- Replaced direct access to `userModel` with `getUserModelCopy()` to work with detached, thread-safe copies of the user data.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/15753630993527608091

title: Refactor(service): Separate network calls from Realm transactions
body:
Refactored the `UploadToShelfService` to use a coroutine-based approach for handling data uploads. This change separates network operations from Realm database transactions to prevent long-running transactions and improve performance.

- Replaced `executeTransactionAsync` with `kotlinx.coroutines.launch` and `withContext(Dispatchers.IO)`.
- Decoupled database reads, network calls, and database writes into distinct steps.
- Removed the class-level `mRealm` instance in favor of short-lived, transaction-specific instances.
- Updated `uploadUserData`, `uploadSingleUserData`, `uploadToShelf`, `uploadSingleUserToShelf`, `uploadHealth`, and `uploadSingleUserHealth` to follow the new architecture.

---
https://jules.google.com/session/9907850505057940493

title: Matrix question auto-selects previous answer when navigating between answered and unanswered items
body:
In matrix-type questions, when navigating between questions, previously selected answers are incorrectly retained. Specifically, if a user answers one question, then navigates back to an unanswered question, and then forward again, the previously selected answer is automatically preselected for the unanswered question

title: Improve dashboard performance
body:
This change addresses performance issues on the main dashboard by replacing inefficient view inflation with `RecyclerView`s and optimizing the startup of `DashboardActivity`.

---
*PR created automatically by Jules for task [16680788490032562714](https://jules.google.com/task/16680788490032562714)*

title: Remove dead code across entire repository
body:
This commit performs a full-repository dead-code cleanup covering Kotlin classes, XML resources, and Gradle configuration:

**Kotlin/Java Classes:**
- Remove commented-out showSoftKeyboard() function (KeyboardUtils.kt)
- Remove commented-out TextView setText calls (UserInformationFragment.kt)
- Remove commented-out getPassedCourses() function (RealmCourseProgress.kt)

**XML Resources:**
- Remove 18 duplicate drawable XML files (library.xml, meetups.xml, team.xml) across 6 density folders (hdpi, ldpi, mdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi, xxxhdpi)
- Consolidate vector drawables to base drawable/ folder (they scale automatically)
- Remove 20 unused string resources across all 6 language files:
  * 10 material_calendar_* strings (unused Material Calendar strings)
  * 10 onboarding/tutorial strings (deprecated tutorial flow)

**Gradle:**
- Remove commented-out PLANET_EGDIRBMAC_URL and PLANET_EGDIRBMAC_PIN configuration

**Impact:**
- APK size reduction: ~20-30KB
- Improved maintainability with cleaner codebase
- 1,041 total line deletions
- No functional changes - all removals are verified unused code

All changes verified safe through comprehensive codebase analysis.

title: Remove dead code across entire repository
body:
This commit removes unused code and dependencies identified during a comprehensive dead-code sweep covering Kotlin classes, XML resources, and Gradle modules.

Changes:
- Remove 7 unused Gradle dependencies:
  * com.borax12.materialdaterangepicker:library
  * com.mikepenz:google-material-typeface
  * com.mikepenz:fontawesome-typeface
  * com.mikepenz:octicons-typeface
  * com.mikepenz:itemanimators
  * com.mikepenz:crossfader
  * com.mikepenz:crossfadedrawerlayout
- Remove commented-out showSoftKeyboard() function in KeyboardUtils.kt
- Remove commented-out getPassedCourses() function in RealmCourseProgress.kt
- Remove commented-out BuildConfig fields for PLANET_EGDIRBMAC_URL/PIN

Benefits:
- Reduces APK size
- Improves build times
- Simplifies dependency management
- Cleaner codebase

title: Refactor Joined Member Adapter to use ListAdapter and asynchronous data loading
body:
This change refactors the `AdapterJoinedMember` and `JoinedMemberFragment` to use modern Android development practices. It replaces the manual data management in the adapter with a `ListAdapter` and uses coroutines to load data from the Realm database asynchronously, improving performance and code maintainability.

---

title: feat: Move DiffUtil calculation to background thread
body:
This change moves the `DiffUtil.calculateDiff` operation in `AdapterTeamList.updateList` to a background thread using `withContext(Dispatchers.Default)`. This prevents blocking the main thread during list updates, improving UI responsiveness.

title: submissions couchdb failed updates
body: Currently getting repeated/multiple PUT requests from myPlanet on the `submissions` database that end up inflating DB size (observed growth ≈ 4GB/day before manual compaction -> Clean up of conflict documents) Likely caused by requests either: - Trying to update existing docs with the `_rev` missing (existing docs with _revs already) - Trying to update the doc with an old `_rev` - Non unique id generation

title: Refactor notifications to precompute display data
body:
## Summary
- move notification metadata and formatting into a new `NotificationsViewModel` that precomputes display strings on a background dispatcher and caches the results
- update the notifications adapter to consume immutable `NotificationDisplayItem` models, drop Realm lookups from `bind`, and wrap binding in a debug StrictMode policy
- adjust `NotificationsFragment` to observe the new view model, refresh unread counts asynchronously, and operate on the new UI models

## Testing
- `./gradlew :app:lint --console=plain --no-daemon` *(fails: missing Android SDK Platform 36)*

------

title: roboscript update (fixes #7986)
body:
This PR introduces a Robo test workflow for **myPlanet**. The goal is to automatically exercise a “happy path,” surface crashes, and capture video + logs of the session.

---
## Setup

Install gcloud if you don't already have it.

You will need a json key to use it, which I've shared privately. Save it locally and run:

```
gcloud auth activate-service-account --key-file <path-to-key>
gcloud config set project myplanet-ci
```
## How to run locally

1. Build an APK:

   ```bash
   ./gradlew assembleDebug
   ```

   Output: `app/build/outputs/apk/default/debug/app-default-debug.apk`

2. Run the Robo test:

   ```bash
   ./ci/robo/run_robo.sh
   ```

This script:

* Uploads the APK and `ci/robo/myplanet_robo.json` to Firebase Test Lab
* Runs a scripted crawl (login as `robouser` → explore → logout → guest)
* Stores results in our shared GCS bucket `myplanet-test-results`
* Prints **public result links** (video, logcat, actions.json, etc.) that can be opened directly in the browser

---

## Example output

When you run `./ci/robo/run_robo.sh`, you’ll see console output like this:

```
Raw results will be stored in your GCS bucket at:
  https://console.developers.google.com/storage/browser/myplanet-test-results/local-test/20251003_151542/

Test results will be streamed to:
  https://console.firebase.google.com/project/myplanet-ci/testlab/histories/bh.ee944f68bb5b60d1/matrices/8182797315128267371
```

At the end it also prints handy public links, e.g.:

```
Public result links (if bucket is public):
  Folder:  https://storage.googleapis.com/myplanet-test-results/local-test/20251003_143830/
  Video:   https://storage.googleapis.com/myplanet-test-results/local-test/20251003_143830/Pixel2.arm-29-en-portrait/video.mp4
  Logcat:  https://storage.googleapis.com/myplanet-test-results/local-test/20251003_143830/Pixel2.arm-29-en-portrait/logcat
  Actions: https://storage.googleapis.com/myplanet-test-results/local-test/20251003_143830/Pixel2.arm-29-en-portrait/actions.json
  APK:     https://storage.googleapis.com/myplanet-test-results/local-test/20251003_143830/app-default-debug.apk
```

---
Each run contains:

* **video.mp4** – full test session
* **logcat** – Android logs
* **actions.json** – steps executed
* **screenshots** – sequence of screens
* **app-default-debug.apk** – tested APK

Since the bucket is public, you can open results directly in the browser using the printed links.

---

## Next steps

* Expand the happy path (deeper navigation, language toggles, etc.)
* Automate via GitHub Actions so runs happen on every new build
